title: ICCV_2003_161_abs

sentences.text: The perception of transparent objects from images is known to be a very hard problem in vision .
Given a single image , it is difficult to even detect the presence of transparent objects in the scene .
In this paper , we explore what can be said about transparent objects by a moving observer .
We show how features that are imaged through a transparent object behave differently from those that are rigidly attached to the scene .
We present a novel model-based approach to recover the shapes and the poses of transparent objects from known motion .
The objects can be complex in that they may be composed of multiple layers with different refractive indices .
We have conducted numerous simulations to verify the practical feasibility of our algorithm .
We have applied it to real scenes that include transparent objects and recovered the shapes of the objects with high accuracy .

Entity-the_perception_of_transparent_obj.description: The perception of transparent objects from images refers to the challenges and methodologies involved in detecting and interpreting transparent objects in visual scenes, particularly through the analysis of image features and the application of model-based approaches to recover their shapes and poses.

summary: The perception of transparent objects from images is known to be a very hard problem in vision . Given a single image , it is difficult to even detect the presence of transparent objects in the scene . In this paper , we explore what can be said about transparent objects by a moving observer . We show how features that are imaged through a transparent object behave differently from those that are rigidly attached to the scene . We present a novel model-based approach to recover the shapes and the poses of transparent objects from known motion . The objects can be complex in that they may be composed of multiple layers with different refractive indices . We have conducted numerous simulations to verify the practical feasibility of our algorithm . We have applied it to real scenes that include transparent objects and recovered the shapes of the objects with high accuracy .

Predicate-are_perceived_from.label: are perceived from
Predicate-are_perceived_from.description: The predicate 'are perceived from' indicates a relationship where the subject is the source or basis of perception, leading to the formation of the object as an interpretation or representation. It suggests that the object is the result of observing or interpreting the subject through a specific medium or perspective.

Predicate-detects_the_presence_of.label: detects the presence of
Predicate-detects_the_presence_of.description: The predicate 'detects the presence of' indicates an action or process whereby the subject identifies or recognizes the existence of the object within a given context or medium. It implies an observational capability that allows the subject to ascertain whether the object is present, often through analysis or examination.

Predicate-is_difficult_to_detect_in.label: is difficult to detect in
Predicate-is_difficult_to_detect_in.description: The predicate 'is difficult to detect in' indicates a challenge or obstacle in identifying or recognizing the subject within the context of the object. It suggests that the subject may be obscured, camouflaged, or otherwise not easily noticeable when considered in relation to the object, which serves as the environment or setting where detection is attempted.

Predicate-detected_in.label: detected in
Predicate-detected_in.description: The predicate 'detected in' establishes a relationship where the subject is identified or observed within the context or environment represented by the object. It implies that the subject can be found or recognized as part of the object, indicating a spatial or situational presence.

Predicate-explores.label: explores
Predicate-explores.description: The predicate 'explores' indicates an active engagement or investigation by the subject into the characteristics, properties, or implications of the object. It suggests a process of inquiry or examination where the subject seeks to understand, analyze, or uncover information related to the object.

Predicate-behave_differently_from.label: behave differently from
Predicate-behave_differently_from.description: The predicate 'behave differently from' indicates a comparative relationship between the subject and the object, highlighting that the subject exhibits distinct characteristics, actions, or responses that set it apart from the object. This suggests that while both entities may share a common context or category, their behaviors or properties diverge in significant ways.

Predicate-recovers.label: recovers
Predicate-recovers.description: The predicate 'recovers' indicates a process or action in which the subject retrieves, restores, or reconstructs information, characteristics, or states that were previously lost, obscured, or not fully represented, resulting in the object being made clear or accessible again.

Predicate-from.label: from
Predicate-from.description: The predicate 'from' indicates a source or origin of the subject, establishing a relationship where the subject is derived or influenced by the object. It suggests that the characteristics or properties of the subject are informed by or trace back to the object, highlighting a directional flow of influence or information.

Predicate-recovered_from.label: recovered from
Predicate-recovered_from.description: The predicate 'recovered from' indicates a relationship where the subject has been obtained or derived from the object, suggesting a process of retrieval or extraction. It implies that the subject's characteristics, features, or information have been identified or reconstructed based on the data or context provided by the object.

Predicate-are_recovered_from.label: are recovered from
Predicate-are_recovered_from.description: The predicate 'are recovered from' indicates a process in which the subject is derived or extracted based on the information or data provided by the object. It implies that the subject's characteristics, features, or states are reconstructed or inferred using the known attributes or conditions represented by the object.

Predicate-can_be.label: can be
Predicate-can_be.description: The predicate 'can be' indicates a potential or possibility for the subject to assume the characteristics or qualities described by the object. It suggests that under certain conditions or contexts, the subject may exhibit the properties or states represented by the object, without asserting that this is always the case.

Predicate-may_be_composed_of.label: may be composed of
Predicate-may_be_composed_of.description: The predicate 'may be composed of' indicates a potential relationship where the subject consists of or is formed from the elements represented by the object. It suggests that the subject can include various components or layers, highlighting the possibility of a complex structure or composition.

Predicate-have.label: have
Predicate-have.description: The predicate 'have' indicates a relationship of possession or existence between the subject and the object, where the subject possesses, contains, or is characterized by the object. In this context, it signifies that the subject is associated with or includes the object as a defining feature or component.

Predicate-conducted_to_verify.label: conducted to verify
Predicate-conducted_to_verify.description: The predicate 'conducted to verify' indicates an action performed by the subject with the purpose of confirming or validating the truth, accuracy, or effectiveness of the object. It implies that the subject undertakes a systematic process or activity aimed at assessing the validity or reliability of the object in question.

Predicate-verify.label: verify
Predicate-verify.description: The predicate 'verify' indicates a process in which the subject conducts an assessment or examination to confirm the truth, accuracy, or validity of the object. It establishes a relationship where the subject takes action to ensure that the claims or characteristics represented by the object are substantiated or proven to be correct.

Predicate-included_in.label: included in
Predicate-included_in.description: The predicate 'included in' indicates a relationship where the subject is a part of or contained within the object. It suggests that the subject exists within the context or boundaries defined by the object, highlighting a sense of belonging or integration. This relationship can apply to various contexts, such as physical, conceptual, or categorical inclusions.

Predicate-recovered_with.label: recovered with
Predicate-recovered_with.description: The predicate 'recovered with' indicates a relationship where the subject has been restored or retrieved in a manner characterized by the qualities or conditions specified in the object. It implies that the process of recovery has been executed with a certain level of effectiveness or precision, as denoted by the object.

Predicate-addresses.label: addresses
Predicate-addresses.description: The predicate 'addresses' indicates that the subject is concerned with, discusses, or provides information about the object. It implies a focus on a particular topic or issue, suggesting that the subject engages with the object in a meaningful way, often aiming to clarify, analyze, or propose solutions related to the object.

Predicate-affect.label: affect
Predicate-affect.description: The predicate 'affect' denotes a relationship in which the subject has an influence or impact on the object, resulting in a change or modification in the state, quality, or perception of the object. This connection implies that the characteristics or actions represented by the subject play a significant role in shaping or altering the experience, understanding, or interpretation of the object.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates a hierarchical relationship where the subject represents a specific category or instance that falls under a more general category represented by the object. This relationship signifies that the subject is a subset of the object, and the object encompasses a wider range of entities or concepts that include the subject.
